speaker: Frasier
text: Dear God!

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a minefield out there!  Everywhere I go, people are talking about this mini-series I've been watching!

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, yeah!  Did you see the ending last night?  When that...

speaker: Frasier
text: Bup, bup, bup, bup!  I attended a benefit last night.  I had to tape it, and I have yet to see it.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, well who would have thought it?  Mr. "PBS" watching a trashy mini-series.

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't think it's trashy at all!  In fact, I think the intricacies of the plot are downright Dickensian.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, Angie Dickensian!

speaker: Frasier
text: Anyway, I'm just having a very difficult time having a conversation without having to avoid people telling me the ending.

speaker: Betty
text: Hi, Roz!  Did you watch last night?

speaker: Roz
text: Yes!

speaker: Betty
text: Wasn't it great when...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, goodbye, Betty. _He pushes Betty outside and closes the door.  FADE OUT.  Scene 2 - Frasier's Apartment. Fade in.  Frasier's Apartment.  Frasier comes through the door and slams his keys down on the case beside it._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hey, Dr. Crane, how was your day?

speaker: Frasier
text: Interminable!  Is the tape in the VCR?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, all cued up.  Oh, you've got to call me when you get to the part with Heather's baby.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_going towards the sherry, turns and stares at her_] Heather had a baby?

speaker: Daphne
text: Sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, who's the father?  Oh no, no, no, don't tell me.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll go put your popcorn in the microwave.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you. _He takes his sherry over to the couch, sits down and gives out a happy little sigh in preparation for an evening of couch potato bliss.  Martin enters._

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hi, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Look, I got some bad news.  I guess there isn't a good way to tell you somethin' like this.  Your god-uncle died.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_confused_] My...god-uncle? [_Martin nods_] There's no such thing as a god-uncle.

speaker: Martin
text: Yes there is!  It's your godfather's brother.  You remember your god-uncle Charlie.

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  I barely even remember my godfather, he died twenty years ago.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah?  Well now his brother's dead too, so shake a leg! The wake's in twenty minutes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, you know as much as I'd like to pay my respects, catch up with my god-cousins and meet the god-neighbors, I have some urgent business that just can't wait until later.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, here's your popcorn...and the remote.  There, enjoy your show.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_getting up_] Oh, all right!  One hour!  I don't even know why I'm going.  The man was a ghoul, he used to hide his glass eye in my marble bag!

speaker: Martin
text: [_excited_] I knew you remembered him!

speaker: Martin
text: Just give me a couple minutes to get changed.

speaker: Niles
text: [_coming in_] Hello, Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Niles.  Ooh, Niles, you'd be smart to get out of here. Dad's dragging me off to a wake for my god-uncle Charlie.

speaker: Niles
text: Is he the one who used to plop his eyeball into his mashed potatoes and say "I'm watching what I eat"?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes!

speaker: Niles
text: So, is Daphne here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Uh, yes, she is.  Why?

speaker: Niles
text: [_hanging up his coat_] I'm asking her out on a date.  And don't give me that look... why shouldn't I?  She's single. I'm single.  That's what single people do.

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you sure you're ready for this?

speaker: Niles
text: Will you stop it?  I'm not talking about eloping here, it's just dinner.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, all right.  I suppose you've thought this through. Maybe it is time.

speaker: Daphne
text: Time for what?

speaker: Frasier
text: Time for me to, uh, put this popcorn away for later.

speaker: Daphne
text: Aren't you going to watch your program?

speaker: Niles
text: Apparently he has to take Dad to a wake.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh. [_She heads for the door._]

speaker: Niles
text: Listen, Daphne.  Do you have a minute?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_turning back_] Sure.

speaker: Niles
text: There's something I wanted to ask you.  Nothing earth- shattering, it's just, uh...

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes?

speaker: Niles
text: [_after a nervous pause_] What's that perfume you're wearing?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_smiling_] Leave it to you to notice.  It's Obsession.

speaker: Niles
text: No!  No it isn't!  I was just curious.

speaker: Daphne
text: No, I'm quite sure it's Calvin Klein's Obsession.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes!  It's very pleasing.

speaker: Daphne
text: I've even spray a bit on my brush and comb it through my hair. Silly really, as if anyone's going to smell my hair. _She leaves, Niles stares dreamily at the door for a second, then rushes to the kitchen._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what did she say?

speaker: Niles
text: I couldn't do it!  I was about to ask the question, then all I could think of was, what if she said "No'?"!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Niles.  No surprise.  After all you've been through with Maris, you were just scared of another rejection.

speaker: Niles
text: I was more than scared, I was terrified.  I can't go on like this. [_He goes to the refrigerator to get a bottle of water._] Worshipping Daphne from afar...  Do you have any idea how frustrating it is to be completely in love with someone and not be able to tell her how you feel? _He turns and drops his bottle in a start.  Daphne is standing in the kitchen doorway with a surprised look on her face.  Frasier is as shocked as Niles._

speaker: Daphne
text: Sorry.  I, I just came back for the fabric softener.  I didn't mean...  I'm sorry. [_She turns and rushes from the kitchen._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_completely panicked_] Oh, my God!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my God!

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, my God!  Frasier, how long was she standing there?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't know.  If I'd known Daphne was standing there, I would have said "Shut up, Daphne's standing there."

speaker: Niles
text: You saw how she ran out of here.  She heard.  She heard everything.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Niles, Niles.  Listen, calm down.  Now listen, this may even be for the best.  You said you wanted to take the next step.

speaker: Niles
text: Next step?!  I was just hurled down the entire flight of stairs!  I can't believe this is actually happening!  Did Daphne really hear me say that [_Daphne comes back in_] I'm completely in love with - AAHH!

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry!  I really do need that fabric softener. _She gets it out of a cabinet while Niles clutches the bottle of water with a look of panic and apprehension on his face, then exits._

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, you've got to talk to her!

speaker: Niles
text: Now?!  I can't!

speaker: Frasier
text: If you wait, it will only become incredibly awkward!  You can't leave things like this, Niles. [_He grabs a sputtering Niles around the shoulders and pushes him towards the living room._] Come on, you've got to resolve it now. Go, go! [_Frasier heads for the bedrooms._]

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane, I didn't mean... _He starts talking and they interrupt each other.  They grind to a halt and -_

speaker: Niles
text: Go ahead.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm terribly sorry.  I know I wasn't supposed to hear that.

speaker: Niles
text: No, I'm glad you heard.  It's something I've been wanting to tell you for the longest time.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, what took you so long? [_She smiles._] I think it's wonderful.

speaker: Niles
text: [_breaking into a surprised grin_] You do?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, of course I do! [_She puts the softener down and runs to him._] Oh, you dear sweet man, give me a hug! _She throws her arms around him.  Niles, stunned and ecstatic, returns the hug.  They share a happy laugh and smile at each other. Daphne takes his hands in hers._

speaker: Daphne
text: So, who is she?

speaker: Niles
text: [_confused_] Who?

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, this woman you're so in love with.  Who is she?

speaker: Niles
text: [_a grin frozen on his face_] You didn't hear that part, did you?

speaker: Daphne
text: No, so come on!  What's her name?  You can't back out now.

speaker: Niles
text: No, you're right, I can't.  OK, her name.  Well, her name just happens to be Da - Phyllis. [_A look of "WHAT did I say?" crosses his brow._]

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I've never heard that name.  DaPhyllis.

speaker: Niles
text: It's a family name.  Her friends call her "Phyllis."  'Scuse me. [_He turns and goes to the kitchen._] I'll get some water.

speaker: Frasier
text: Where's Niles?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, he's in the kitchen.  I'm sorry to barge in on the two of you like that.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's all right Daphne.  Did you and Niles have a little chat?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes!  He was a bit shy at first, but then he came clean. I must say, I couldn't be happier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that is wonderful!  Let me be the first to raise a glass to... [_Niles charges in from the kitchen, alarm in his eyes and waves him off with a big gesture._] to god-uncle Charlie. You know, Daphne, as long as you're doing the laundry, the kitchen towels could use a washing.  Oh, and my oven mitts are getting a bit crunchy.

speaker: Daphne
text: All, right then. _Daphne heads to the kitchen.  Niles has sunk onto a chair at the table._

speaker: Frasier
text: What the hell is going on?

speaker: Niles
text: All she heard was that I was in love with someone.  She never heard who.  And when she asked, I panicked and blurted out the first name that popped into my head - Phyllis.

speaker: Frasier
text: Phyllis?!

speaker: Niles
text: It's a neighbor I saw on the elevator this morning.  The woman had a sesame seed stuck between her front teeth.  It was the size of a blanched almond.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, lord.

speaker: Niles
text: Maybe it was a blanched almond.  If she had Muselix for breakfast it could have been...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_grabbing his hand_] Niles, stop!  You have got to clear this up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, I'm off to...bring the car around for Dad.

speaker: Daphne
text: Bye-bye.

speaker: Niles
text: Bye.

speaker: Daphne
text: All right now:  Tell me more about this Phyllis.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh.  Actually, Daphne, I'd rather not.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, come on, you said you wanted to talk about it. So, have you asked her out, yet?

speaker: Niles
text: No.

speaker: Daphne
text: And why not?  You said yourself you were in love with her. [_Martin enters._]

speaker: Martin
text: In love with who?

speaker: Daphne
text: Phyllis.

speaker: Martin
text: Who's Phyllis?

speaker: Niles
text: [_getting up_] A woman I met.

speaker: Daphne
text: And he's quite keen on her.  I've just been giving him some dating advice.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Niles.  All you need to know is that women go crazy for flattery.  It doesn't matter if it's a big fat lie: They'll still buy it.  But whatever advice Daphne's giving you too, must be great.  'Cause she's smart as a whip.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you Mr. Crane.

speaker: Daphne
text: So, tell me about this dream woman of yours.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, I don't know.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, come on!  I can see you're crazy about her.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, all right.  She's very beautiful.  And very sweet. And she has a smile that makes my knees weaken. [_Daphne smiles at this and Niles looks away as his heart speeds up a bit._]

speaker: Daphne
text: You know Dr. Crane, if this woman is as wonderful as you say she is, then you shouldn't waste another moment.  She won't be on the market forever.

speaker: Niles
text: You're right.  I've been a fool to hesitate as long as I have.

speaker: Daphne
text: That's the spirit!

speaker: Niles
text: I'm gonna do it!

speaker: Daphne
text: Good for you!  Don't leave time for second thoughts. [_She grabs his coat from the hall._] You go ask her out this instant.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne, that won't be necessary.

speaker: Daphne
text: I know you're feeling brave, but it's quite nasty out.

speaker: Niles
text: No, you don't understand.  I don't have to leave this room to ask "Phyllis" on a date.

speaker: Daphne
text: You don't?

speaker: Niles
text: No, because, [_he steels himself_] because you see, Daphne: [_he looks her right in the eye_] I know her work number by heart!

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, then! _Daphne turns to grab the phone, and Niles clenches his fists and stomps his feet in a tantrum against his own cowardice.  When Daphne turns back, he puts a big smile on his face and turns the stomping into a happy little jump.  Daphne bounces up and down a couple of times with him._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, look at me!  My heart's racing!

speaker: Niles
text: [_dialing_] Mine, too.  Phyllis, hello!  Niles Crane!  How are you? ... Um, I was wondering if you would want to have dinner with me sometime? _CUT TO: Niles' apartment at the Montana.  The answering machine is on a table._

speaker: Niles
text: [_voice over from machine_] You would?  How 'bout tonight at my place? ... Eight o'clock sounds great! _FADE OUT  End of Act 1  Act 2_ **THE POTATOES ARE THE POLITICIANS** _Scene 1 - Niles' Apartment Fade in.   Niles's apartment.  He is sitting on the sofa, playing solitaire while talking on the phone._

speaker: Niles
text: So, anyway, what would you do, if you were in my position? Would you tell her everything and just let the chips fall where they may, or...?  Uh, yeah.  Well I do see your point. [_Doorbell rings._] I have to run.  So, I'll take the three-year subscription and the travel clock.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne!

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.  I was out doing some shopping, and I, I thought you might need some desert for your big dinner with Phyllis tonight. [_She comes in._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes!  Well, I was just doing some last minute tidying up [_grabs up the playing cards_] for that...

speaker: Daphne
text: And I suppose you've got about eight things cooking on the stove.

speaker: Niles
text: Of course.

speaker: Daphne
text: So, I'll get out of your way.  Soon as I pop this in the fridge.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no.  Please, don't trouble yourself.  I'll do it. _They enter the kitchen.  It is spotless, with nothing being cooked at all.  There is a box by the stove._

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane!  There's barely enough pasta her for one person. Is this your idea of a romantic dinner?

speaker: Niles
text: Well...

speaker: Daphne
text: Ugh, thank heavens I stopped by. [_Opens up the refrigerator._] I can whip up a salad with what's in here, I'll stick this roast in the microwave to defrost, where do you keep the cooking sherry?

speaker: Niles
text: You know what, Daphne, you're right.  I am completely under- prepared for this.  Why don't I call Phyllis and put her off until next week?

speaker: Daphne
text: You're not backing out of this now!  Don't worry, I'll fix this place RIGHT up for a nice intimate evening.  Candles, some soft music...  I know those things always put me in a romantic mood.

speaker: Niles
text: Well I suppose it would be rude of me to cancel...

speaker: Daphne
text: Course it would.  Now hurry up and get ready!  And wear that blue blazer of yours, no woman can resist you in that.

speaker: Niles
text: Right.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good lord, look at the time! [_She grabs him by the shoulders and pushes him out of the kitchen._] Honestly, Dr. Crane, sometimes I wonder what kind of a fantasy world you're living in.  Now go on! _She slaps him on the backside.  He jumps and a silly grin joins the faraway look as he races up the stairs.  DISSOLVE TO:  Scene 2 - Niles' apartment.  There is a small, intimate dinner table set for two.  Daphne has lit candles all over the apartment.  An opera is playing on the stereo.  Niles (in his blue blazer) comes down the stairs, stunned at what she has done to the place._

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, don't you look handsome.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  Daphne, this place looks wonderful.  And excellent choice of music, I love this aria!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, she has a gorgeous voice, doesn't she?  It's a pity she never got quite the recognition of a Joan Sutherland or a Renata Tebaldi.

speaker: Niles
text: [_surprised at the depth of her comment_] I had no idea you knew so much about sopranos.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, well, you don't live with your brother for five years and not learn a thing or two about divas. [_They laugh as she moves to the kitchen._] By the way, the roast is coming along nicely.  How are you at chopping vegetables?

speaker: Niles
text: Are you kidding?  You don't get forearms like these from just... conducting your stereo.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, I'm very excited for you.  I just love first dates. [_They wash their hands in the sink together._]

speaker: Niles
text: I don't see why.  They're always so awkward.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, but once in a while, when the chemistry's just right, they can be magical.  The "me, too's" as you realize all you have in common, the electricity of that first accidental touch... Soon, you're letting your guard down and saying the silliest things.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, sorry.  You touched me, now we have to get married.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_giggling_] Here you are. [_She hands him a towel.  Again, he has a "WHAT did I just say?" look._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_brushing past her_] Sorry.

speaker: Daphne
text: Sorry.  Now, I was thinking for the salad: some cucumbers and carrots.  How 'bout some celery? [_She begins cutting carrots as he slices the cucumber._]

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, no.  No celery, hate the stuff.

speaker: Daphne
text: Me, too.  Why do you have it, then?

speaker: Niles
text: I guess it's just habit.  Maris used to liked to have it around in case she felt like binging.

speaker: Daphne
text: When I was little, I actually thought celery was the meanest vegetable.  Radishes were the smartest, beets were the policemen...

speaker: Niles
text: Do you hear that?  We're chopping in rhythm.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, we are, aren't we? [_To the rhythm of the chopping -_] Dum-da, dum-da, dum-da, dum-da...

speaker: Niles
text: Heart and soul, I fell in love with you, Heart and soul, The way a fool would do...

speaker: Both
text: Madly! Because you held me tight, and stole a kiss in the night!

speaker: Niles
text: Buh-buh-buh... _The break up laughing and playfully slap each other on the arms. The doorbell rings._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, damn!  Who could that be?

speaker: Daphne
text: [_excited_] It's Phyllis! _Niles gets a look on his face along the lines of "You're probably right.", followed by "HUH?"_

speaker: Daphne
text: Well go on!  Go and let her in. [_Pushes him towards the door._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_singing under his breath_] Go away, whoever's at the door, Go away, And don't come back no more...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!  I thought you were supposed to be at a wake.

speaker: Frasier
text: We left!  Even the mourners were babbling about the mini- series.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, I'm sure you're in a rush to get back home and watch the rest of the show...

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Niles.  Actually, everybody's heading over to the Kiwanis club to have a post-wake kegger.  Could you please take Dad?

speaker: Niles
text: Me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Please!

speaker: Niles
text: Well, they're your god-family!

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, Dr. Crane.  I thought you were Phyllis.

speaker: Frasier
text: Phyllis?

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, she's due any moment, so you better be runnin' along. I'll be leaving meself as soon as the roast is done. _Frasier's mouth is open in shock, Niles is staring at the floor in embarrassment._

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne... is cooking dinner... for your date with a fictitious woman.  Why not just set a place for the March Hare and the Mad Hatter?!

speaker: Niles
text: I didn't plan for this to happen, but we are having the most perfect evening!  I'm feeling my confidence return, I just need a few more minutes _alone_ , and I'll be able to tell her everything. [_The doorbell rings._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, the longer you continue with this absurd lie, the more likely it is to blow up in your face!

speaker: Niles
text: Why are you always such a doomsayer?  As long as I keep track of what I'm saying, nothing is going to blow up on anyone! [_He opens the door, a woman is standing there._] Phyllis!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_whimsically_] Ka-Boom!

speaker: Phyllis
text: Hello, Dr. Crane.  Some of you mail wound up in my box today.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, well, aren't you considerate?

speaker: Phyllis
text: [_to Frasier_] Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, I'm Frasier, Niles's brother.

speaker: Phyllis
text: Oh, well, I hope I'm not interrupting anything.

speaker: Niles
text: As a matter of fact, we... _Daphne comes in from the kitchen.  Frasier watches all of the next bit with a very bemused smile on his face._

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello... You must be Phyllis!

speaker: Phyllis
text: Yes.  Do I know you?

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm Daphne. [_as a private aside_] I'm just a friend. [_She heads back to the kitchen._] Make yourself comfortable.  We were starting to worry about you.

speaker: Phyllis
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Daphne
text: Can I get you a glass of wine?

speaker: Phyllis
text: Well, all right, I guess.  I mean I really just came by to drop off...

speaker: Daphne
text: I'll be back in a snap. [_She goes into the kitchen._]

speaker: Phyllis
text: That woman seemed to think that you were expecting me.

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I've been making an effort to meet my neighbors, and I guess you didn't get the invitation.

speaker: Phyllis
text: No.  It's just dumb luck that I happened to stop by tonight.

speaker: Daphne
text: Here we are.  Now, the appetizers are almost ready, and it won't be too much longer before the roast is done.  I hope you're hungry. [_She goes back into the kitchen._]

speaker: Phyllis
text: Oh, the invitation was for dinner?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, but don't you worry about it a bit, we'll do it another time!

speaker: Phyllis
text: Well, I'd love to stay.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Niles.  Frasier, you comin' or not?

speaker: Frasier
text: In a minute, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Daph!  What are you doing here?

speaker: Daphne
text: Helping Dr. Crane with his dinner.

speaker: Martin
text: [_to Phyllis_] Oh, hi!  How ya doin'?  Marty Crane.

speaker: Phyllis
text: Hi, I'm Phyllis Conrad.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, ho, ho.  You're Phyllis, hunh?

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't worry, we'll be going soon.  I know Dr. Crane's eager to have you all to himself.

speaker: Phyllis
text: Really?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, yeah, he's been going on about you all week.

speaker: Niles
text: Now, Dad...

speaker: Martin
text: How pretty you are, how nice you dress...

speaker: Niles
text: Dad, you don't want to be late for your kegger...

speaker: Martin
text: Look at him!  I've embarrassed him.  He's blushing!

speaker: Phyllis
text: He's not the only one!

speaker: Niles
text: Excuse me, Phyllis.  Frasier?  Could I, uh, just... [_jerking his head towards a private corner_] You've gotta help me get rid of her!

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes!

speaker: Frasier
text: I've got my hands full with Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: So, you really never had any idea he had his eye on you?

speaker: Phyllis
text: Well, I did catch him staring at me in the elevator, this morning.  Now I know why.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, would you give me a hand with the appetizers?

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier? [_He goes to the kitchen._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad?  You know, I guess it was time we were going.  Maybe you could just press for the elevator and I'll be right there in a minute.

speaker: Martin
text: All right.  Very nice meeting you, Phyllis.

speaker: Phyllis
text: Yeah, bye-bye.  [_Martin leaves._]

speaker: Phyllis
text: Well, I must say:  Your brother certainly kept his feelings to himself; until tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, well, he's always been the quiet type.  Especially... since all the trouble with Heather.

speaker: Phyllis
text: Heather? _CUT TO: the kitchen; Daphne is giving Niles a plate of appetizers and last minute instructions._

speaker: Daphne
text: Now remember, the pie should be heated, and there's fresh whipped cream to put on the strawberries. [_In a risque voice_] Or anything else if the night should take that turn... _Niles lets out a little laugh, with an 'Oh my God' face, then goes to the living room, where -_

speaker: Phyllis
text: [_whispering_] His wife was poisoned?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_also whispering_] Don't worry.  He stood trial, they never proved a thing. _Niles comes up behind Phyllis and offers the plate up.  He is very nervous/anxious for Phyllis to be gone, but in light of Frasier's comments, looks a lot like Peter Lorre in a dangerous mood._

speaker: Niles
text: Crab puffs?

speaker: Phyllis
text: No.  Thank you.  I, I just remembered.  There is someplace... that I HAVE to be.  Thank you very much for the wine. [_to herself_] Oh my God, I drank the wine! _She desperately fumbles with the door and departs as quickly as possible._

speaker: Niles
text: Well, thank you!  What did you tell her?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll explain later, Niles.  Tell you what, though: don't plan on running for the co-op board here anytime soon.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_bringing the salads out_] Where'd Phyllis go?

speaker: Niles
text: She left.  She said she wasn't feeling well.

speaker: Daphne
text: I hope you don't mind my saying so, you almost seem relieved that she's gone.

speaker: Niles
text: Relieved?  Well, Daphne, to tell you the truth, I am relieved.

speaker: Daphne
text: I knew it.  This is all my fault.

speaker: Niles
text: Hmm?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's as clear as day, now.  You're just not ready for a relationship, and there I was pushing you into it

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: Even I could see how uncomfortable you were with Phyllis. Well, she must have picked up on that, too, and that's the real reason she left.  What was I thinking? [_She sits down on the couch._]

speaker: Niles
text: [_sitting beside her_] No, Daphne, this is not your fault.

speaker: Daphne
text: Yes, but I should have seen.  You're on the rebound, you're still vulnerable... That's probably why you have so much trouble asking for a simple date in the first place.

speaker: Niles
text: [_realizing_] Yes, I, I suppose you're right.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm so sorry, Dr. Crane, I guess you just need to take some more time.  You know, if you rush things you may end up ruining something that has a real chance.  No smart woman would ever get involved with a man that's in the middle of a divorce, anyway.   I know I never would.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, thank you, Daphne.  This has all been very helpful. [_He rises._] AND thank you for everything you did tonight, even if it didn't work out exactly as I'd hoped.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, what are friends for?

speaker: Daphne
text: I suppose we should start clearing all this up. [_She rises._] _Niles turns, without excitement or nervousness, but instead a pure calm resolution._

speaker: Niles
text: Actually, Daphne... would you like to stay and have dinner with me?

speaker: Daphne
text: You mean that?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well... yes, that would be lovely.

speaker: Niles
text: Wonderful.  May I pour you some wine?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, yes. [_She goes to him by the bar._] You know, I know it seems hopeless right now, but I have a feeling that before very long you'll be sitting down to a nice, romantic dinner with the woman of your dreams.

speaker: Niles
text: I think you may just be right.  Shall we?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, thank you. _Niles leans forward and smells her hair. He gets that faraway look again.  Then he sits opposite her._

speaker: Daphne
text: [_raising her glass_] Here's to us! _They touch glasses.  The opera comes up as they chat animatedly over dinner.  FADE OUT_
